Package de.awi.floenavigation.initialsetup

Provides the necessary Activities and Fragments required for setting up the Floe's Coordinate System.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    CoordinateFragment
    This Fragment runs on top of the GridSetupActivity and displays the location of the Fixed Station which is being deployed.
    GridSetupActivity
    This is the primary FragmentActivity for the Initial Setup of the Coordinate System.
    MMSIFragment
    This Fragment runs on top of the GridSetupActivity and shows the layout for inserting the first two Fixed/Base Station.
    SetupActivity
    This Activity sets up the Coordinate System by calculating the angle DatabaseHelper.beta by using the two base stations (origin and x-Axis marker) inserted by the MMSIFragment and CoordinateFragment.

Package de.awi.floenavigation.initialsetup Description

Provides the necessary Activities and Fragments required for setting up the Floe's Coordinate System. The Grid is setup by adding two AIS Stations as Fixed/Base Stations. The Grid Initial Setup starts with the Activity GridSetupActivity on which two Fragments are run.

The Fragment MMSIFragment is used to add the Station Name and MMSI to the Database tables DatabaseHelper.fixedStationTable and DatabaseHelper.stationListTable. It then loads the Fragment CoordinateFragment.

The Fragment CoordinateFragment then waits for the AISDecodingService to receive an AIS Position report from these Stations; while waiting the CoordinateFragment layout shows a waiting screen. Once the AIS Position report is received the layout displays the Geographical coordinates received and the coordinates of the tablet itself. It then loads MMSIFragment again to add a second Fixed/Base Station in the same manner. When the second station is added and the position report is received and displayed, then the CoordinateFragment starts the SetupActivity.

The SetupActivity runs the setup process. This activity displays the the MMSI and received coordinates of both Fixed/Base Stations. It also predicts the next position of each station using the Speed Over Ground (SOG) and Course Over Ground (COG) information which is received in the AIS Position Report. It then compares the predicted position with the received position using the NavigationFunctions.calculateNewPosition(double, double, double, double) and NavigationFunctions.calculateDifference(double, double, double, double). It also calculates the Angle DatabaseHelper.beta of the coordinate system with the received coordinates and the predicted coordinates. This Activity runs this comparison for the time specified by the Configuration Parameter DatabaseHelper.initial_setup_time; at the end of which the user can choose to re-run the comparison or exit to MainActivity.

See Also:
DatabaseHelper, NavigationFunctions
